meanings.definition: To throw or toss something with force
meanings.sent1: He pitched the ball to his friend during the game.
meanings.sent2: She pitched the stone into the pond and watched the ripples spread.
meanings.sent3: The boy pitched the idea of a picnic to his family for the weekend.
meanings.sent4: The chef pitched the dough high in the air to make the perfect pizza crust.
meanings.sent5: The farmer pitched hay into the barn to feed the animals.

meanings.definition: To set up or erect a tent or other temporary structure
meanings.sent1: They pitched their tent in the middle of the campsite.
meanings.sent2: The campers pitched their shelters quickly before the storm arrived.
meanings.sent3: The kids pitched a makeshift fort in the backyard using blankets and chairs.
meanings.sent4: The workers pitched the event canopy for the outdoor party.
meanings.sent5: The hikers pitched a small shelter to rest during their trek.

meanings.sent1: The road pitched downward, making it easier to ride the bike.
meanings.sent2: The roof of the house pitched at a steep angle to shed snow easily.
meanings.sent3: The hillside pitched sharply, making it challenging to climb.
meanings.sent4: The ski slope pitched at a thrilling angle for experienced skiers.
meanings.sent5: The slide pitched downwards, sending the children laughing to the bottom.

meanings.definition: To set a specific musical tone or key
meanings.sent1: The pianist pitched the melody in a cheerful key for the song.
meanings.sent2: The singer pitched her voice perfectly to hit the high notes.
meanings.sent3: The band pitched the tune in a lively key to get the crowd dancing.
meanings.sent4: The orchestra pitched the symphony in a grand key for the performance.
meanings.sent5: The guitarist pitched the chords in a soothing key for the ballad.

meanings.definition: To engage in a sales pitch or presentation
meanings.sent1: The salesperson pitched the new product to the potential customers.
meanings.sent2: She pitched her business idea confidently to the investors.
meanings.sent3: The entrepreneur pitched his startup concept at the conference.
meanings.sent4: The team pitched their project proposal to the board of directors.
meanings.sent5: The marketer pitched the advertising campaign to the client with enthusiasm.
